Reviews.Title: “10 out of 10”
Reviews.Author: Andrew F Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: A marvellous hotel! on a quiet side street . Spacious and exceptionally clean rooms, a gracious and exceptionally helpful staff plus a very good breakfast. All-in-all, an exceptional hotel in one of the world's most cosmopolitan cities.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in a great location in a great city.”
Reviews.Author: Travelibrarian
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. I have stayed here once or twice per year for the last 5 years. The staff are charming, the breakfast is good, the location is perfect. If you take the 197 bus from Schiphol Airport, it will drop you about 4 blocks from the hotel. This will set you back 4 euro rather than the 35 or so for a taxi. I almost never take trams in town as I can walk to almost everything I want to visit. This trip I stayed in one of the large doubles which was very roomy. I often stay in one of the singles which are fairly small, but well laid out. If you push your bag under the desk you aren't tripping over it and it is fine for one person. The rooms are very clean with lots of hot water and at a very reasonable price. There is a lovely back yard off of the breakfast room where you can watch the parrots - not native to Amsterdam, but these escapees have certainly thrived.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for a 4 Person Room”
Reviews.Author: Kevin T
Reviews.Content: We were here on a last second trip to Amsterdam. The 4 person room had 4 single beds, but the nice part was it also had a nice little sitting room. So while this isn't exactly a posh place, it was good value at about 230 USD for the night we stayed there. The location is also easy to get around once you have a decent map!

Reviews.Title: “A Great City Pad”
Reviews.Author: Turmstrasse
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated in a quiet residential street which is no more than a 10 minute walk from Leidseplein where you will find many shops and restaurants. Our spacisous ensuite room was clean and comfortable with pillows that ensured we had a good night's sleep. The breakfast buffet was of both ample choice and quality. The staff were lovely always smiling and extremely friendly. I must give a special mention to Snoopy the cat who lives there too. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “quiet area, next to fondel park”
Reviews.Author: kazy2
Reviews.Content: my friend and i staied in this hotel for couple of nights. i like the garden for relaxing after breakfast. clean room, and friendly staff. i forgot how much was this....i thought it was expencive for me to save up but i would stay at this place next year too.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: luckygirlkris
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located on a quiet street, but yet was only a five minute walk to Leidseplein with all it's happening nightlife and abundant restaurants, and less than a ten minute walk to the museums (Rijksmuseum and Van Gogh museum). It's also a five minute walk from the bus that takes you from/to the Schipol airport, and the museum tram stop is nearby. Our room was quite small but comparable to other European boutique hotels. The have wi-fi but charge for it (12 euro for 5 hours). A continental breakfast (cold cuts, hard boiled eggs, toast, cereal, juice and coffee) is included and is in a nice room overlooking a patio garden, with the resident cat lounging on the sofa by the window. It's nice that the breakfast goes until 10:30 am. The staff was great, the co-owner (husband) was very friendly and quite entertaining at times. Sometimes it's that kind of memorable touch that makes or breaks a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Cap86
Reviews.Content: Very quiet hotel (with the exception of Gregory the cat) with friendly and helpful staff. Good location particularly for museums and trams. Single room more than adequate with a small balcony overlooking garden of hotel. Recommended if you want a small, friendly hotel in a busy city.

Reviews.Title: “The staff is great...”
Reviews.Author: Amywsp
Reviews.Content: I'll start with the positives: First, the staff at this hotel are fantastic! Ruth (I think was her name) was so helpful and friendly. She answered all our stupid questions with a smile. Second, the location is good. It is steps from Leidseplein while still quiet enough. We, of course, walked everywhere, but it is convenient to have so many places to eat or grab a drink nearby. Lastly, the breakfast and breakfast area were nice. We ate outside in the garden area the first day. There were breads, cereals, meats, cheeses, and other things that kept us full until lunch. Okay, now for the not-so-good: The room: We stayed in a small double, which was small but not the smallest we stayed in. It just didn't feel clean enough, although I think it could just be the walls and bedding and such. A paint job and some new linens would go a long way. The bathroom: It smelled. In general: We didn't bring our cell phones because it was cheaper for us to buy a calling card to call the U.S. I used the card at the hotel but had to pay per minute just to call out. I don't understand why they would charge you to make a free call. I don't care if every other hotel in Amsterdam does it, too; that doesn't make it right. We stayed on the 4th floor and walked up the incredibly steep spiral stairs every time we needed to get to the room because the lift was VERY slow. The city: Amsterdam was not my favorite city. It is really neat and cute with all the canals and old houses, but it all felt dirty. There were urinals on the street! Also, my husband and I had a few beers at a bar and I had to pay to use the restroom there! I was already paying 5.20 euros per beer and I had to pay .50 euro to use the restroom! While we did enjoy the Anne Frank House and the museums, I don't think we would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel a bit tired, but very friendly staff and good location”
Reviews.Author: GuruandL
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Hestia is a small hotel, with very friendly staff. It is very well located, close to the Leidseplein for restaurants, trams and canal boats. The breakfasts were good and the dining room very pretty with an outlook to the garden, a bonus in the middle of the city. However, our room and bathroom were Very Small, even by small room standards. The stairs are extremely steep and winding, luckily there is a small lift. The rooms are really in need of a facelift. However, the location and the friendly staff compensate for that. Amsterdam is an expensive location for accommodation, but make sure you ask for a large room!

Reviews.Title: “enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: 21atfm
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed staying here. Friendly and helpful staff. Free beverages upon arrival and before departure. Nice dining area room with excellent breakfast. Rooms are small, but comfortable and clean, and have desks with lamp, which I always need. Good beds with comforters. The room I stayed in had a balcony facing the rear which is quiet and charming, with green parrots flitting about -- real surprise in northern Europe! Watch out on the tiny spiral staircase, which can be dangereous. The elevator is tiny and slow, but adequate. I liked it here, and found it a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Big family room in good central location”
Reviews.Author: PreeceFamily
Reviews.Content: Located right by the Vondel park in a quiet street - the family room we had on the first floor was large and spacious and full of character with a view over the park. Breakfast was good and service was good and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “LOCATION ! LOCATION ! LOCATION !”
Reviews.Author: Solo54
Reviews.Content: I needed a hotel for one more night in Amsterdam. Didn't realize it was Queen's Day weekend and all hotels (including the one I was booked into) were full. The Hestia graciously allowed me to stay just one night. The location is very convenient and I was able to do all the things I'd planned on for my last day and night in Amsterdam.......staff are pleasant, the room, although small, was clean and comfortable and there was even a small balcony off my room (#1) that I enjoyed. And Gregory, the house cat, greeted me and sat with me on the main patio in the back.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet. Clean. Friendly. Not luxury, but perfect for us.”
Reviews.Author: cksiam
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for just one evening. Based on Tripadvisor reviews, we booked a room before we went. Emailing and reservations were quick and responsive. We had a medium twin room and it was small (by American standards), but not cramped. My wife and I were perfectly comfortable in it. We had a top floor room at the back of the hotel. Very quiet. Breakfast was decent and the price was right. Staff was wonderful. As for location, again it was quiet and Amsterdam is small enough everywhere is easy to get to. If we're ever in Amsterdam again, we will stay at Hotel Hestia.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the money. Great location”
Reviews.Author: holub78
Reviews.Content: Clean and well located little hotel. Only few minutes from city centre. Dogs are welcome. The small room was really small but clean. Very friendly and helpfull staff. I recommend parking at P+R @ Olympisch Stadium, which costs only 6 Euro/day (versus 40 euro/day outside the hotel)...

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: rsg1952
Reviews.Content: My wife, thirteen-year-old son and I stayed for two nights in July 2010. The room was really nice-- large with a good size bathroom and a terrace overlooking a garden. The hotel was about a five minute walk to museums and the Leides Square, where there are many restaurants, cafes and bars. The staff were friendly and helpful. The free breakfast was good. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal with the best location in Amsterdam !”
Reviews.Author: Shane1977
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean and feels very homely and the staff help to keep it that way. The hotel's strongest point is the location, a few mins walk to the lively Leidseplein area but away so your not disturbed by the crowds and noise, the other side of the hotel leads to Vondelpark which is a must see if just for a stroll through. The staff are extremely warm and make you stay very comfortable and are willing to chat with you on anything. The rooms are basic but very clean and ours was really spacious as we had a triple room, the breakfast is nothing special but who cares there's tons of stuff to snack on around Amsterdam. I would definitely stay here again if we returned.

Reviews.Title: “Great value friendly family hotel”
Reviews.Author: phy9pas
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during a cycling trip to Amsterdam and the hotel couldn't have been more helpful. They let us leave our bikes in the back garden and were very friendly. Three of us stayed in a four bed room on the top floor. Very spacious rooms with high ceilings. Decoration is traditional but very clean and well maintained. The stairs are quite narrow and steep, so you might struggle if you're old or frail. The breakfast was very much what you can expect in a Dutch hotel - cereal, breads, cheeses, fruit etc. Good quality food which sets you off nicely for the day. The dining room looks onto the small garden at the back which is very pleasant. I can't recommend this highly enough - great value and great standards for a budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel stay, as usual.”
Reviews.Author: hang
Reviews.Content: This is 5th time I have stayed at the Hestia. We were a party of 3 staying for 6 nights. We had separate beds in a LARGE, clean room. It is a very clean hotel with helpful workers. While small, the breakfast, which is included in the price, was enough. Who wants to pay an additional 10 - 20 EURO per person for a breakfast. The location is also great.

Reviews.Title: “Good for college kids who don't want to stay in a hostel.”
Reviews.Author: Sisaggie
Reviews.Content: We booked this trip last-minute as a stay-over in Amsterdam the night before we left Holland. The price was decent, the staff very welcoming and accommodating, and the breakfast and breakfast room was very nice and lovely. The rooms, however, were not the cleanest, and that is what turned me off to the hotel. The beds and towels were clean, but the chairs were stained. The bathroom smelled mildewy, were cramped, did not appear the cleanest, and only a curtain separated the teeny shower area from the toilet. I was grossed out by the smell, the floor did not appear the cleanest, and was not very keen on stepping onto that floor with bare feet. If you have shower shoes, and superior cleanliness is not of the utmost importance to you, then this hotel is a very good value. I would recommend it to university students or people who are used to camping or sharing bathrooms. The value was decent at 104 Euro for one night in a big city. The mini bar was also priced affordably as well.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: bru44
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is well located: 3 minutes from Leidseplein, but in a very quiet street; price is reasonnable for Amsterdam; room was clean, as well as bathroom. Breakfast included, with a reasonnable choice of food. The really nice thing is the owner: you are really welcomed and he is ready to help for any question or problem. Having a chat with him about the weather, enjoying breakfast while stroking the cat... very different from large hotels! If I come back to Amsterdam, I will use it again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: KatkinLondon
Reviews.Content: We had the quad room which was huge, clean, with comfy beds and a sitting area. The room overlooked a peaceful garden and was perfect for a group of friends. Service was efficient and friendly and breakfast was a decent range of breads, cereals, fruit, meat and cheese. The hotel is a 5 minute walk to Leidseplein, with its many bars, restaurants and shops. The red light district was a 20-25 minute walk but you can easily get the tram. Reasonable value for money, but we were disadvantaged by the weak pound. The walls are quite thin in the hotel and you can hear other guests up and around in the morning but we didn't find this a problem. We had a great stay at the Hestia and would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MV_Troll
Reviews.Content: Despite the fact that we booked a "medium" size room, the room was so small that we couldn't even open the luggage on the floor. The room was not particularly clean, at the top floor. In the warm days the room was boiling and stairs and lift were really small. The bathroom was definetely old and poor. Staff ok, breakfast really good. Superb location, walking distance from restaurants and bar. The area is very safe. The price was 125 euros per night(including 2 breakfast), too much. I think all the hotels are too overpriced in this city... Anyway, I wouldn't recommend Hestia!

Reviews.Title: “We really enjoyed out stay!”
Reviews.Author: rubylouby
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed in The Hestia in mid March this year. We arrrived late and we had to extend our booking. They were very accommodating and we had an fantastic room - the one at the front of the hotel - the balcony with the flags. The room was spacious and the hotel is in a great area, close to everything. The staff were friendly and helpful and I would certainly recommend this hotel and indeed stay there if we were lucky enough to visit Amsterdam again.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend this place”
Reviews.Author: moth-trapper
Reviews.Content: We had a 3 bed room for a 2 night stay. Some of the most welcoming staff of any Amsterdam hotel I have stayed in and I have been to perhaps 15 or so over the years. The beds were extremely comfortable and the room clean and spacious. I usually struggle to find good value in this area of Amsterdam but the Hestia provided that as well. I will return to this hotel next time I visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: shelby52
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a four day stay at the Hestia with a group of friends. Location was excellent. Five minutes from the bustling Leiseplein area (with trams to all other areas of Amsterdam) yet situated on a quiet street. There was very little noise during the night. Check-in was fast, easy and efficient. The rooms were very clean and quite spacious for Amsterdam, equipped with a TV, radio, hairdryer, safe etc. Beds were comfy and there was spare blankets provided. The stairs were a bit steep but there was a perfectly accessible lift so it was easy to get up and down. Breakfast was totally fine, what I expected for the very reasonable price, and the coffee was delicious! There was a lovely veradah to sit outside, and a house cat named Gregory. Rooms were cleaned every day to a good standard and fresh towels were provided. However, what made this stay so enjoyable was the combination of excellent facilities for the price, and excellent customer service. It is a very personal service at the Hestia. Whenever we needed help, for directions or advice, nothing was too much trouble for them. We were able to store our bags for as long as necessary on the last day as we had a late connection. The Hestia is just fab, would recommend to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Really, Really Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Miss_Buttercup
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at Hotel Hestia for 2 nights at the beginning of July and had an amazing experience. The hotel staff was extremely helpful and friendly, which made our stay at Hestia that much more enjoyable. The room we stayed in was a small double and it was really small, but nonetheless it was clean and comfortable. We only used the room to sleep and shower so the size didn't matter. The continental breakfast was also great...you get your basics: juice, milk, toast, eggs, cereal, coldcuts, cheese, coffee, tea, etc.The dining area is nicely set up and there is also a beautiful backyard where you can enjoy your breakfast and have a coffee. Hestia is located on a small side street just five minutes from Leidseplein so you don't need to use public transportation to get around. We did, however take the tram from the Central station because we had 2 big suitcases which would've been hard to carry from the station. Overall, we really, really enjoyed our stay at Hestia and would recommend it to anyone who is looking for a clean, comfortable and friendly hotel for a good price.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: Sycamore72
Reviews.Content: I visited the Hotel Hestia during my first trip to Europe, and my first solo trip. I booked a single room, situation in the front of the building. It was small, but comfortable. The bathroom was very small, but average size for Euro hotel bathrooms. My luggage was lost en route from Scotland to Amsterdam, and the customer service number they provided me had recordings in Dutch. The owner of the hotel offered to call and arrange for me to receive my luggage. She was a godsend!! I can't say enough about how much she improved my stay in the country. The location is perfect, about equidistant from the liedesplein, the vondelpark and the museumenplein. It was also easily adjacent from a number of public transport stations.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: GeorgiaMurphy
Reviews.Content: I stayed here recently with my 2 sons (ages 9 & 11). The hotel is perfectly located near the museums and leidisplein. The staff is awesome - extremely friendly and professional. The rooms were clean and our triple room was extremely large by European stds. I would recommend this hotel highly to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Alli2732
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights on our first trip to Amsterdam, and our experience with the hotel was great. We arrived before our room was ready, but the manager on duty stored our bags and let us relax on the hotel's back patio after our long flight. I was expecting a much smaller room based on some reviews, but we had the double-twin medium room and there was plenty of space for us and our luggage. Staff was always very friendly and helpful, and the breakfast spread in the morning always kept us full until lunch. The hotel is on a nice quiet street, but the great restaurants and bars in the Leidsplein as well as tram stops are only a short walk away. It also backs right up to Vondelpark which we really liked. You won't get luxury here, but we were more concerned with enjoying the city than our hotel. Would definitely stay here again, and would recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “So helpful”
Reviews.Author: Shandong
Reviews.Content: We were three older couples; stayed for three nights. Only minus was the rooms were small. Otherwise this hotel is a great value! Quite clean, very quiet, no street noise, a lift, a nice variety for breakfast, pleasant breakfast room and lovely outdoor patio. The well-staffed desk will arrange cabs, tours, you name it. Ruth made us a breakfast "goody bag" to take with us for our 7:15 a.m. plane the night before. Staff could not have been more helpful or kind!

Reviews.Title: “strange name, smashing hotel”
Reviews.Author: laygatelad
Reviews.Content: This is an unassuming but absolutely spot-on hotel.Our room was large and clean.The hotel's location is great, in a nice quiet pleasant street but with Leidesplein an easy 5 minutes walk away ,vondelpark even closer and nothing really far away.The breakfast room is nice ,with a small charming patio garden off .Breakfast was limited in choice but not volume, and was absolutely fine .The hotel has an understated character.The staff have not been on the corporate greet and meet course as it is a private family hotel, but they'll look after you just the same.We'd definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaJackson
Reviews.Content: The bigger rooms are spacious and nice. Quiet, architechturally quaint street; half a block down are six buildings side by side, each representing a different European style. Big Vondel park is real close, as is Leidsplein with all the restaurants. If you can hoist your bags on the tram, it's an easy five minute walk from the stop at Leidsplein. Good breakfast. Friendly lady working day shift. petty crime warning: If you come as a group keep eyes open for the odd street urchin trying to take advantage of front door confusion and making off with a handbag or wallet--and I'd heed the same warning in Vondelpark.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect! Definately Recomend”
Reviews.Author: loznbails
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Hestia for 3 nights in a large room on the 2nd floor (sorry cannot remember the #) we had already had our hopes dashed on a lot of hotels though our 6 week honeymoon but arriving to Hestia was like almost coming home. On arrival we were greated by Ruth (we arrived at 9am in the morning) who had our room all ready for us, she gave us maps and info on Amsterdam which we found really helpful. Ruth took us to our room and explained everything to the finer detail in the room and all so showed us the breakfast room...... The room had a double/queen and another single against the wall, a medium sized bathroom and a large balcony overlooking the start of the vondelpark. The hotel is in a brilliant location walking distance to thr Ryksmuseum, Van Gogh museum, coster diamonds, leidesplein and the red light district (or if your lazy like we were on some days super close to catch a tram)......

Reviews.Title: “I thought it was pretty good”
Reviews.Author: DBLHampshire
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel during the weekend 19/22 October travelling with my wife and another couple. We were very lucky to have room 15 which is large, spacious and includes a balcony overlooking the rear of the premises. The room was clean, simple without being over decorated and had a bath and shower.Our friends felt aggrieved as they had paid the same price but were stuck in an attic room with two single beds pushed together. Their room was cramped. I loved our room though the lighting was very dim. The hotel is ideally located and once we discovered how the tram system worked it was easy for us to travel from near the hotel right to the heart of the city. The staff were very friendly and spoke excellent English. Breakfast was different to the good old fried breakfast and there was plenty of it. The one thing that was strange about Amsterdam is the thin narrow stairs which are very steep (great for the calf muscles) The lift helps though as without it i wouldn't recommend it for young children or the the elderly. I am sure there are many finer hotels in Amsterdam but you get what you pay for and afterall this is a capital city. Would I stay there again? Absolutely !

Reviews.Title: “Little gem in quiet area near the action”
Reviews.Author: pigletthepug
Reviews.Content: Husband, 2.5 year old, and I stayed for 1 night at Hestia. We just arrived in Amsterdam from a looong trip from Asia, and needed a place to stay before taking the train to Brugge. We paid 168 euro for a room with 3 twin beds, inclusive of breakfast and taxes. To be honest, when I first arrived, I was rather shocked by the smallness of the hotel and the room. But a later stay at a different Amsterdam hotel conveyed that Amsterdam small hotels are just that....they are small. BUT, we had a very nice stay. The location was super nice. In a quiet area, but just 5 mins walk to the Leidsplein. We could oped the windows at night. The beds were super comfy. The breakfast was adequate. The rooms were clean. And we had space to put 2 big suitcases and a stroller in there. There were lots of other similar hotels in the area (we saw Owl, Vondel, Roemer). I suspect these hotels are all quite comparable.

Reviews.Title: “Would have given Hestia 5 stars......”
Reviews.Author: stepping-razor
Reviews.Content: ...if my double room was a little more comfortable and larger. I stayed for 5 nights and although I was by myself, the room was rather tiny. It wasn't too much of a problem because, like I said, I was alone, but the bathroom was way too small and particularly narrow. So narrow that I couldn't bend over the sink because when you stand in front of the mirror, your back is already pressed against the wall! That's pretty narrow. My main gripe would be that another double room in the hotel probably costs the same but is most likely larger. Other than that, the hotel is great. The staff very friendly and helpful in every way. Room cleaned and towels changed everyday. Safe and fridge in the room along with tv and phone. Perfect location if you want a nice quiet place to stay. Very close to the nothern entrance to Vondelpark. A brief walk to Museum area. 5 Minutes from Leidesplein..... After many stays in Amsterdam over the years, I consider Hestia a nice deal, especially if you're at least 2 people traveling, since you will probably get one of the decent size rooms. I recommend it highly, all things considered.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly as it said on the tin!”
Reviews.Author: enbeebee
Reviews.Content: Just back from staying at this hotel and can report that it was a good experience. The room (a medium one) was a decent enough size with TV, mini-bar, safe etc. Everything clean and tidy. The bright and airy breakfast room was welcoming in the morning. The buffet breakfast was ample with plenty of choice of cold meats, cheeses, eggs and cereals. If you really wanted to you could eat to your heart's content! People in other reviews have commented about the small lift. Yes, it is small, but my wife and I and a case fitted in cosily, and hey, who stays in the lift! The staff were friendly and helpful (thanks Ruth and Arnuld and the others whose names I never caught). All in all recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Really disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Britraveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed recently in this hotel and thankfully for only one night. Staff very obliging , location very central, quiet and refined and on the whole the hotel could be described as clean but our room was ludicrously small. We were in room 35 - top floor facing the front - and I am not exaggerating when I say the room housed a double bed and that was all. If we wanted to open the suitcase we had to put it on the bed and there was no room to put anything anywhere. The bathroom was also tiny - so cramped and box like - a small shower cubicle and a tiny sink and toilet. Maybe we drew the short straw because I saw other rooms that were being cleaned and they were much bigger. I would have not expected to pay the price I did for this room. I would also have expected a reduction for being given this room which needless to say we were not awarded. I heard the hotel manager asking another guest at breakfast if they wanted to change their room to something bigger as they were staying a few nights - maybe this is their policy - shove guests into the small room if they are not spending lots of time or money there. Disappointed. Be careful.

Reviews.Title: “Only place I'll stay in amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: sissywrites
Reviews.Content: Three of us (my mom, a friend and I) stayed at the Hotel Hestia the last week in May and I can honestly say I will not look for another hotel in amsterdam. This is it, the one we will stay at any time we go back. What a location. Just a few minutes walk to Vondlepark, one way, and a few minutes walk to Leidsestraat or a canal bus the other direction. And yet the Hestia is on such a quiet street you feel like you're miles away. Perfect. What a room. Our triple was huge, even for american standards. And totally clean and updated. Now I have heard that some of the doubles and singles are on the smallish side, but I can only comment on our room. HUGE. Three comfortable beds, a table with four chairs, a large balcony overlooking the street.......who could ask for more. All I can say is if youre looking for comfortable beds in a quiet clean room, this is it. What a staff. The gentleman who checked us in had only been working at the hotel for a few weeks and was perfectly lovely, completely helpful, and genuine as could be. The morning staff who fixed the breakfast and ran the desk were wonderful as well. Sweet, fun, and helpful yet again. There are parrots in the backyard area and an adorable cat named Gregory who hangs out in the breakfast room. The price was perfect too. All in all we LOVED this hotel and would highly recommend it. Do be careful though as the stairs are steap and the elevator is tiny, not for wheelchairs unfortunately as there are no bottom floor rooms. See you at the Hestia.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for money”
Reviews.Author: hammersbabe
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel in May'2007, and it was fantastic. We have been to amsterdam a couple of time so knew what area we wonted to stop in, we wonted peace and quite and to be away from the hustle and bustle of the city and this hotel was fantastic. on a side street just off vondel park, the location couldnt have been better, and just round the corner from the ledei-square exactly what we wonted.The rooms were large and spacious,with a HUGE window. (when we've been to amsterdam before the bedroom windows are usually very small and make the room look dingy) The Lift was extremely small and scary but thats about the only thing we could moan about( and thats just being picky), the breakfast room was bright and cosy, the staff were extremely friendly and just wonted to help and make recommendations of where to go and what to see. The minibar in the room was Very cheap but the hotel didnt mind you buying your own stuff and just using it as a fridge. All in all this was one of the best hotels ive stayed in and should be visited by anyone traveling to amsterdam. I would def. stop at this hotel again and def. recommend to any1 thnkin of stoppin at this hotel it was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: PTDtravelers
Reviews.Content: Great value for basic creature comforts. Located on quiet street near museums and Vondel Park. Small tidy rooms, adequate lift, nice breakfast, and very helpful staff. Recommended to anyone, singles, families, seniors, couples, looking for quiet, basic lodging. Would definitely stay here again and recommend to friends/family.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic quality, great location, breakfast & staff”
Reviews.Author: HappyHols2007
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a 4-night stay here with my Mum and we felt that we couldn't have chosen a nicer hotel. For the price (we paid 140 euros per night for a large triple room as all twins were booked), it was superb. The room was HUGE (and had a balcony too), the breakfast was lovely with plenty of choice (cheese, ham, cereal, muesli, yoghurt, fruit, boiled eggs and a variety of breads to toast), and the little breafast room was delightful, with french doors leading out to small, sunny garden, which was frequented each morning by 3 green paraqueets! The location was perfect too. In a quiet, exclusive-feeling road, but just 5 minutes walk from the Leidseplein (a hub for nightlife and bars), canal bus stop for tours, and practically next door to the Rijks Museum, Van Gogh Museum and Vondel Park. Tram stops from the Leidseplein also take you to Dam Square or Centraal Station in around 5 minutes. Perhaps not ideal for younger traveller who want to be within a short walking distance of the old centre (home to the red light district, shops, famous 'cafes', Dam Square, lots of restaurants etc...), but for us this was a bonus - the centre, although the oldest part, is not exactly the most 'desirable' or pretty part of the city. We felt we were much better off where we were and really if you wanted to, you probably could walk to Dam Square within 30-40 mins. At the end of the day, Amsterdam is pretty small, so if you don't mind walking a bit it doesn't really matter where you are! All in all, a fantastic stay that could not be faulted.

Reviews.Title: “Great family hotel”
Reviews.Author: KGN86
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in April (recommendation from the Rick Steve's book). My husband had a conference in the Dam area, and none of the conference hotels would accommodate 4 people! This place was cheaper than most of the conference room hotels, and breakfast was included! Since I was traveling with my husband and two kids (6 & 9) I wanted a place that was safe and quite. This hotel was ideal for us. We stayed in room16, (which was large by European standards) it had a nice balcony overlooking a quite street. Since my son got sick soon after our arrival, it was nice having a large room that allowed my husband to work while my son got through his illness. We also stayed in Room 2 (which is even larger), it had a nice view of the back patio. I originally booked the hotel for 3 nights, but realized I needed it for another night for our flight out, and luckily they were able to accommodate us. The pillows/bed/showers were very nice. I'm afraid my kids will be spoiled because it was so nice. It is very close to the Leidsplain and Museum area, so you can walk to alot of sites. If you want to get to the center of town, it's only a 5-10 minute trolley ride to the Red Light District and Dam area. (Get a strip card from the TI at Leidslain about 6E for a strip card of 15. You need to use two strip cards/trip.) The breakfast was fine for everyone, no one felt hungry. The kids especially like the chocolate sprinkles to put on their bread. You can buy a wifi card if you bring your own computer.

Reviews.Title: “a great recommendation”
Reviews.Author: EdinburghMike
Reviews.Content: Hestia was recommended to me by a work colleague & I wasn't disappointed. A small, family run and very friendly hotel. Stayed 4 nights in a 3-bedded room (no. 16) which was plenty large enough for us, and has a wide balcony overlooking the street. Room very clean and comfortable: our only grumble was the shower temperature was fiddly to set / adjust as both hot & cold flows had to be set separately. Breakfast buffet was perfectly adequate, albeit anyone looking for hot food will have to be contented with only boiled eggs. Location was very convenient for the Liedseplein, where there are masses of eateries to choose from (especially if you're fond of Italian) and also within easy walking distance of the museums area. Would be happy to stay at the Hestia again.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice small hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shennin
Reviews.Content: We found hotel hestia to be clean, safe and quiet. The rooms were very comfy, the beds were heaven, and the family who run it were very friendly, and polite. The breakfast was fine for us, but if you like a huge cooked breakfast you will be a bit miffed! Only quibble was the noise from the lift beside our room, otherwise there was no noise. Its in a great location, we would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, cozy rooms - don't hesitate!”
Reviews.Author: LauraGraz
Reviews.Content: Terrific staff! Clean, cozy rooms, soft comfortable beds. And yet, the bathrooms are something out of a Tim Burton movie. I'm surprised I didn't hear a Danny Elfman tune ever time I lifted the toilet seat lid. However, for the price you cannot get anything better in Amsterdam. The location is terrific. This was my third visit and second time I've stayed at Hotel Hestia. My last visit started in a different hotel that was the same price, but so offensive that I had to change to Hotel Hestia. This time I searched the internet for two solid days trying to find the perfect hotel. Lo and behold, Hotel Hestia came up on top of my search each time. Using Hotels.nl also was a terrific experience. Lowest prices on the internet by a landslide. NB: keep your hotel key with you. They are a small family run hotel and lock the doors at night. If you have your key, no problem. If you are running late for check in just give them a call. They will stay up waiting for you with a warm smile and greet you at the door. If you are a seasoned traveler who has stayed in many cheap hotels then you will understand why this one is a gem. If you are looking for luxury and American standards you will be disappointed. This is a quirky, cozy hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely family run hotel”
Reviews.Author: lightweight
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel fairly late on having been put off of the original one I'd booked. Found it easily from the instructions given. Easy to get to from Centraal - choice of 3 trams, and only a few minutes from tram stop. Lovely family run hotel - made us welcome. Beds comfortable, rooms are a little small, but had everything we needed including a mini-bar (farily reasonably priced) and a safe which we used. Ony criticism was that our room (number 40) was right next to reception / front doors. Consequently we were woken up early both mornings by people checking out/talking / phone ringing / radio. Breakfast was good, fresh fruit & yoghurt, cereals, toasts etc. Also we were given a 10% off voucher for the canal boat which we used. Overall we would definitely go back, but would ask for a different room!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Monyesz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel just 2 nights from 28th of August. The hotel was small, but very nice. I better like this kind of hotels than the big, huge glittering hotels. First of all, the staff (I think it was a family) were very kind and helpfull. We were in the medium room. This was nice, bright and clean, little bit small but confortable (in Amsterdam everything is small :-) ) . The breakfast was good. There was breads, toast, salami, ham, cheese, eggs, mÃ¼zli, joghurt, milk, jam, mixed fruits, tea, coffee and orange juice. The breakfast room was nice and clean too. The hotel milieu and all Amsterdam was wonderful. The transport from the hotel was very easy, just a little walk and there is everything: tram station, restaurants, shops, bank and beautiful streets. If I will go to Amsterdam I will choose this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Quite nice”
Reviews.Author: marksooty
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well located near to museums, park, canal bus stop, bars and restaurants. We had arranged a late arrival which caused no difficulties, we had room 15 and our fellow guests room 22, both are large doubles and at the rear of the hotel. Ours had a balcony and both were quiet and spacious. The stairs were steep but thatâ€™s typical of Amsterdam but the lift was fine. The bar in the room was reasonable priced, the room was clean, with sufficient storage, the bed comfortable and there was no outside noise to disturb us. Two slightly negative points were the lack of Tea and Coffee making facilities, but if you take a travel kettle there are sufficient power points, also the temperature of the shower was a little difficult to control. The staff were friendly and allowed us to leave our luggage after we had checked out. The breakfast was sufficient it wasnâ€™t particularly imaginative but was fresh and you could eat as much or as little as required. Over all Iâ€™ve not stayed in other Amsterdam Hotels so cannot really compare but would be very happy to return to this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just returned this week 4-05 from a stay at the Hotel Hestia. Overall it is a great little hotel and staff were very nice and helpful. I stayed in a Single Room which looks just like the pictures on their site BUT was very tiny. They switched me after my 1st night to another single room ( not sure why). The 1st room has a balcony and garden view but was near the elevator and stairs and was a bit noisy. The 2nd room faced the street but the bathroom was larger and seemed bigger but with no balcony. Overall the only problem was hot/cold temp of the shower- hard to control and noise at night with the stairs. Otherwise it was quiet and the bed was tiny single but comfortable. The room was cleaned daily and TV had cable and decent breakfast was included. Due to Smoking rooms my room did get Smokey smell at night_ I do not smoke. But for the money and location near the Museums I would stay again. Due to bad planning I had to leave before the trams started and I needed a taxi which the staff called and arranged for me- they were great and let me check out the day before and just leave my key on the front desk. Price for the whole stay was exactly as I had booked it-no surprises.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice reasonable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Amsterdam having stayed at hotel hestia for 4 days, we were very pleased with this little hotel, the family who run it were very polite and friendly. The hotel is clean and in a lovely neighbourhood,its quiet at night with no street noise, but the elevator does make a bit of noise, the rooms are small, but tidy and clean,the showers could be a bit more powerful, but they did the job, breakfast was very nice and we found it to be plentiful. We would return to this hotel, we foudn it to be good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: sent2coventry
Reviews.Content: Myself and my girlfriend stayed at the Hestia in early March. Arriving late on a Wednesday night was not a problem, and we were in our room within 5 minutes! As we were on the 4th floor, we just about managed to get our luggage in the compact lift - luckily as like most places in Amsterdam, the stairs are steep! We had a small double room, we knew what to expect and were very happy with it. It was clean and tidy, and the bathroom was very clean. The mini-bar is an added bonus, and we did take advantage!!! Be careful though, you can run up a bill! The hotel is well situated, 5 minutes walk from Leidseplien [sp] area/square, which is excellent for travel links around Amsterdam [canal bus & trams]. It is also very close to the Museum area and the Vondelpark. Overall we were very happy with the Hestia, and would definetly recommend it. It made our stay in Amsterdam very enjoyable.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Hestia
HotelInfo.Address: Roemer Visscherstraat 7, Amsterdam 1054 EV, The Netherlands
